RTVF 554 MFA in Documentary Media: Thesis I
Fall 2016

Instructor: Ines Sommer
Office hours: TBD

This course is the first in a three quarter MFA sequence in which each student focuses on creating either a 12-20 minute film OR an interactive/new media thesis project. Students will develop and/or refine their thesis proposals and fully immerse themselves in the production phase of their projects. Students are expected to spend a significant amount of time outside of class producing their thesis projects, with footage and string-outs to be reviewed in class.

In addition, students will engage in critical analysis of several documentaries, provide feedback for other students' projects during class discussions, and develop an artist statement. Each student will also develop a short presentation and written essay that critically analyzes a filmmaker's particular film or body of work and describes its relevance to the student's own work and approach to the medium.

Required Materials
1. Portable Hard drive at least 2TB, 7200RPM and with two of the following: USB 3.0,Thunderbolt, or FW800.

2. Incidentals (travel, etc.) for your specific project. Cost will vary depending on the project the student pursues.

There will be required readings and viewings (both in-class and out-of-class viewings).
Required Text: TBA
Approximate cost $75
